### Full IP Ownership Clause (Employee Contract – Section 8)
```
All inventions, designs, developments, improvements, works of authorship and any other intellectual property created by the Employee during the term of employment shall be the exclusive property of the Company. The Employee hereby assigns to the Company all right, title, and interest in such Intellectual Property, including any rights to file, prosecute and maintain patent, trademark, copyright, or any other protection. The Employee agrees to cooperate fully with the Company in the preparation, filing, and prosecution of any applications for protection of such Intellectual Property.
```
---
**Summary**
- All IP created by the employee during employment belongs to the Company.
- Employee automatically assigns all rights, title, and interest in that IP to the Company.
- Company may file, prosecute, and maintain patents, trademarks, copyrights, etc., for the IP.
- Employee must cooperate with the Company in any IP protection processes.
